availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney. Henry County, Kentucky, native. Son of William Durrett and Elizabeth Rawlings Durrett. Married to Elizabeth Humphreys Durrett on December 16, 1852. Father of Lily Bates Durrett and William T. Durrett. Attended Georgetown College in Georgetown, Kentucky. Graduated from Brown University in Providence, Rhode Island, in 1849. Graduated from law school at the University of Louisville in Louisville in 1850. Practiced law in Louisville from 1850 to 1880. Owned and edited the Louisville Courier from 1857 to 1859.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson, Louisville, p. 82.
